meanings.definition: Success or failure apparently brought by chance rather than through one's own actions.
meanings.sent1: Winning the lottery was just pure luck.
meanings.sent2: She believed her luck changed when she found a four-leaf clover.
meanings.sent3: His luck was so bad, he tripped over his own shoelaces.
meanings.sent4: Luck seemed to dance around her, touching everything she did.
meanings.sent5: The old man's luck was like a fickle friend, showing up when least expected.

meanings.definition: Good fortune; advantage or success, considered as the result of chance.
meanings.sent1: Finding money on the ground was a stroke of luck.
meanings.sent2: His luck in finding parking spots always amazed his friends.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her luck was so good, she could find a needle in a haystack.
meanings.sent4: Luck was like a hidden treasure waiting to be discovered by those who believed.
meanings.sent5: The cat seemed to bring luck wherever it went, leaving a trail of good fortune behind.
